description: TEHRAN – Sepahan and Zob Ahan football teams shared the spoils in a 1-1 draw in Isfahan derby on Sunday.
title: Sepahan, Zob Ahan share spoils in Isfahan derby: PGPL

description: TEHRAN – On the occasion of the 44th anniversary of the Iran-Iraq War, the Army of the Islamic Republic of Iran has reiterated its dedication to upholding the dignity, resilience, and territorial integrity of the nation.
title: Army reaffirms commitment to national defense on 44th anniversary of Iran-Iraq War

description: TEHRAN – Major General Mohsen Rezaei, former chief commander of Iran's Islamic Revolution Guard Corps (IRGC) and current secretary of Iran’s Expediency Council, stated that Iran and the broader Resistance Front are "on the verge of a great victory" that could lead to the expulsion of the United States and its allies from the West Asia region.
title: Former IRGC chief says Resistance Front on verge of major victory

description: TEHRAN – The Islamic Revolution Guard Corps (IRGC) has dismantled a network with ties to Israel operating across six provinces in Iran.
title: IRGC dismantles Israeli-linked network in six Iranian provinces

description: TEHRAN – General Mohammad Reza Naqdi, Deputy Coordinator of the Islamic Revolution Guard Corps (IRGC), has emphasized that the patience of nations has reached its limit in light of Israel’s recent missile strikes against occupied territories and Lebanon.
title: World’s patience wears thin as Israeli strikes in region peaks: IRGC commander

description: TEHRAN- Hezbollah has announced it has targeted the Ramat David Airbase and other sensitive sites in the northern Israeli city of Haifa.
title: Haifa bombing is just the beginning

description: TEHRAN – The spokesperson for the Iranian Foreign Ministry has emphasized that the United States must acknowledge its legal and international obligations regarding its collaboration with the Israeli regime in relation to offenses committed against Palestine, Lebanon, and Syria.
title: U.S. must stop Israel, Iran foreign ministry says as region teeters on brink of war

description: TEHRAN – Brigadier General Ali Akbar Talebzadeh, Deputy Commander of the Iranian Army's Air Force, announced during a military parade in Bushehr on Saturday that Iran has secured its place among the world's top 10 nations in the space industry.
title: Commander declares Iran among world's top 10 space powers

description: TEHRAN – Iranian Foreign Minister Abbas Araqchi who is currently in New York to attend the 79th session of the UN General Assembly has highlighted the Gaza crisis in discussions with international officials.
title: Gaza takes center stage in Araqchi’s talks in New York

description: TEHRAN - Shargh devoted its editorial to the current sensitive situation in the region and Iran's policy towards it.
title: Full-scale war and extensive diplomacy

description: TEHRAN – Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has voiced strong criticism of the United Nations' response to the actions of the Israeli regime in the region.
title: Pezeshkian criticizes UN's response to Israeli actions ahead of General Assembly

description: TEHRAN – In response to the tragic coal mine explosion that killed dozens of workers on Sunday, Leader of the Islamic Revolution Ayatollah Seyyed Ali Khamenei has ordered Iranian officials to the site to assess the situation and prevent future accidents.
title: Leader orders response after deadly mine explosion

description: TEHRAN – Mojtaba Amani, the Ambassador of Iran in Beirut, has shared an update on his recovery following injuries sustained during twin Israeli attacks that caused thousands of pagers and walkie-talkies to explode in Lebanon.
title: Iranian envoy shares recovery journey after Israeli pager attack in Lebanon

description: TEHRAN - At least 32 people, including two children, were killed and thousands more injured, many seriously, after communication devices, some used by Hezbollah members, dramatically exploded across Lebanon on Tuesday and Wednesday.
title: Are electronic devices becoming time bombs?

description: Flames of anger have enveloped Israelis in the wake of their army’s failure to make good on its promises in the ongoing war against the Gaza Strip.
title: Inferno of frustration: Fury sweeps Israel as captive crisis deepens

description: The defense minister of Yemen’s Ansarullah said the group is prepared to launch many more missiles, including hypersonic ballistic missiles and explosive-laden drones, that they have used before to target Israel in support of Palestinians.
title: Yemen’s Ansarullah warns that Israel will face more ‘painful strikes’

description: On live television, heavily armed Israeli soldiers raided Al Jazeera’s occupied West Bank bureau in Ramallah at the weekend and handed the bureau head, Walid al-Omari, a notice to shut it down.
title: Israel closes Al Jazeera bureau in Ramallah

description: Hamas has praised Hezbollah after the Lebanese resistance group launched overnight rocket attacks at Israel.
title: Hamas hails Hezbollah “bravery, resilience” after overnight attacks on Israel

description: The West is "obsessed" with the idea of waging war against Russia until Ukraine runs out of men, Kremlin Spokesman Dmitry Peskov said.
title: Kremlin: West obsessed with fighting Russia until Ukraine runs out of men

description: Sri Lanka elected Marxist-leaning Anura Kumara Dissanayake as its new president on Sunday, putting faith in the 55-year-old's pledge to fight corruption and bolster a fragile economic recovery following its worst financial crisis in decades.
title: Sri Lanka picks Marxist-leaning Dissanayake as president to fix economy

description: Hezbollah deputy chief Naim Qassem said on Sunday that the Lebanese resistance movement was in a "new phase" in its battle against Israel.
title: Hezbollah: Lebanese resistance movement in 'new phase' of battle with Israel

description: TEHRAN – Iran defeated France 4-1 and advanced to 2024 FIFA Futsal World Cup and advanced to the Round of 16 as the table toppers.
title: Iran beat France in 2024 Futsal World Cup

description: TEHRAN-A Persian translation of the book “Classical Liberalism: a Primer” written by Eamonn Butler has been released in the Iranian book market.
title: Book on classical liberalism available in Persian

description: TEHRAN- A lineup of six Iranian films will go on screen at the different sections of the 25th edition of Ojai Film Festival, which will run in the U.S. city from October 31 to November 4.
title: Iranian films to compete at Ojai film festival

description: TEHRAN-A bilateral cooperation agreement was signed between the Tehran International Book Fair and the Baghdad International Book Fair (BIFF) during the 25th edition of the BIFF, which was held in Baghdad, Iraq, from September 12 to 22.
title: Iran, Iraq sign coop. agreement at Baghdad International Book Fair

description: TEHRAN-Babak Khajeh Pasha’s directorial debut feature film “In the Arms of the Tree” has been officially chosen to represent Iran at the 2025 Academy Awards.
title: Iran submits family drama “In the Arms of the Tree” to Oscar 2025

description: TEHRAN - Archaeologists have proposed legal boundaries of Tape Bor in western Iran after discovering evidence from the Chalcolithic period, the 2nd millennium BC, and the Parthian era.
title: Boundaries set for 5000-year-old hill in western Iran after Chalcolithic and Parthian remains found

description: TEHRAN - The historical village of Kondazi, located a few kilometers away from the UNESCO-listed Persepolis, is currently undergoing a restoration project aimed at preserving its traditional architecture and cultural heritage.
title: Kondazi village near Persepolis undergoes restoration

description: TEHRAN - Kermanshah province, located on the border with Iraq and a significant battleground during the 1980-88 Iran-Iraq War, remains a lesser-known destination for war tourism despite its rich historical and cultural significance.
title: Untapped potential of war tourism in Kermanshah province

description: TEHRAN - For travelers visiting Tehran and seeking a break from the city’s hustle and bustle, Bam-e Tehran (Tehran’s Roof) offers a peaceful and refreshing retreat with stunning panoramic views of the metropolis.
title: Bam-e Tehran, a panoramic escape for travelers exploring the capital

description: On Sunday, September 22, President Masoud Pezeshkian officially started the new school year by attending a girls’ school in Tehran. Some 16.5 million students will attend schools in the 2024-2025 school year.
title: President Pezeshkian officially starts school year

description: TEHRAN –The extensive and acknowledged activities of the Iranian Red Crescent Society (IRCS) at the national and international levels can be an added value for the BRICS member states, Sergei Alexeyevich Ryabkov, the Deputy Foreign Minister of the Russian Federation, has said.
title: IRCS expertise ‘an added value’ for BRICS: Russia's Ryabkov

description: TEHRAN –The International Day of Sign Languages is observed annually on September 23 globally to celebrate the richness of sign language culture and highlight the preservation and promotion of the linguistic identity of all deaf people.
title: ‘Sign up for Sign Language Rights’

description: TEHRAN –As sand and dust storms (SDSs) hotspots in Iraq severely affect western and southwestern regions, the administration underscores cooperating with Baghdad to address the problem.
title: Iran prioritizes co-op with Iraq to mitigate SDSs

description: The last painting exhibition of Mitra Eslami titled “Deep Sleep” is underway at the Idea Gallery in Tehran. Launched on September 13, the exhibition will continue until September 28.
title: Mitra Eslami: the painters’ duty is to see current problems in their society

description: TEHRAN- Seyyed Ammar Hakim, the leader of Iraq's National Wisdom Movement, has expressed deep regret and sympathy for the tragic mining accident in Tabas, South Khorasan province, which resulted in numerous fatalities and injuries.
title: Iraq's Hakim Expresses Condolences Iran Regarding Tabas Mine Incident

description: TEHRAN- Production of sponge iron in Iran rose by 11.6 percent during the first five months of the current Iranian calendar year (March 20-August 21), as compared to the same period of time in the past year, according to the data released by the Iranian Steel Producers Association (ISPA).
title: Sponge iron production up 11.6% in 5 months on year

description: TEHRAN - The transit of commodities through the roads of Iran increased by 73 percent in the first five months of the current Iranian calendar year (March 20-August 21) compared to the previous year’s corresponding period, according to a report released by the Road and Urban Development Ministry.
title: Transit via Iran’s roads rises 73% in 5 months yr/yr

description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the People’s Republic of China has published on its website Position Paper of the People’s Republic of China for The Summit of the Future and the 79th Session of The United Nations General Assembly. The following is the summary of the published text.
title: China’s position paper for Summit of Future and UN General Assembly 79th Session

description: TEHRAN - Mohammad Reza Ramezani, the Deputy head of Iran Chamber of Commerce, Industries, Mines and Agriculture (ICCIMA) for Legal Affairs has called for the full implementation of the law on continuous improvement of the business environment.
title: ICCIMA calls for enforcing law on business environment improvement

description: TEHRAN - The optimization projects manager of Iran's Power Generation, Distribution, and Transmission Company (known as Tavanir) has said the country needs a policy package in which all issues such as currency supply, imports, licenses, measures to support investors, etc. have been seen in order to develop renewables.
title: Tavanir calls for policy package to support developing renewables

description: TEHRAN - Secretary General of the Gas Exporting Countries Forum (GECF) Mohamed Hamel, who visited Tehran earlier this month to discuss and coordinate holding the 26th Ministerial Meeting of the forum in late October, has written a letter to Iranian Oil Minister Mohsen Paknejad thanking him for his hospitality.
title: GECF secretary general writes appreciation letter to Iranian oil minister

description: TEHRAN – Iranian Finance and Economic Affairs Minister Abdolnasser Hemmati has written a letter to five other ministers asking them to help fund private sector projects, Tasnim News Agency reported.
title: Hemmati calls on ministries to help fund private sector projects

description: TEHRAN – Head of the Tehran Leather Producers Union Mahmoud Mousavi says Iran is self-sufficient in producing 80 percent of the raw materials needed in producing different kinds of bags, IRIB reported.
title: Iran 80% self-sufficient in bag production raw materials

description: TEHRAN – Iran’s men’s goalball team head coach Bahman Doosti Vala is unhappy with his team’s fifth place in the 2024 Paralympic Games.
title: Goalball coach Doosti dissatisfied with result in 2024 Paralympics

description: TEHRAN – Iran’s Saipa lost to the Philippines’ Monolith Skyrisers 3-1 (25-19, 25-18, 19-25, 25-18) in Pool B of the 2024 Asian Women’s Club Volleyball Championship on Sunday.
title: Saipa lose to Monolith Skyrisers in 2024 Asian Women’s Club Volleyball Championship

description: TEHRAN – At least 30 people have been killed and 17 others injured after a gas leak explosion in a coal mine in the eastern province of South Khorasan late on Saturday.
title: Coal mine blast in eastern Iran kills at least 30

description: TEHRAN – At least 32 people have been killed and 24 others injured after a gas leak explosion in a coal mine in the eastern province of South Khorasan late on Saturday.
title: Death toll in coal mine blast in eastern Iran rises to 32

description: TEHRAN – At least 34 people have been killed and 24 others injured after a gas leak explosion in a coal mine in the eastern province of South Khorasan late on Saturday.
title: Death toll in coal mine blast in eastern Iran rises to 34
